main_definition: Hard refers to something that is firm, difficult to bend or break, challenging, demanding a lot of effort or endurance.

meanings_and_examples.example: The cake was hard because it had been left out overnight.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Difficult to bend, break, or penetrate
meanings_and_examples.example: She found the rock hard and couldn't chip off a piece of it without tools.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Demanding much effort; severe in its effects on one
meanings_and_examples.example: He has to work really hard to keep up with his studies while working part-time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Challenging or demanding a lot of time and energy
meanings_and_examples.example: The project was so difficult that it took her team months to complete it.
She has a hard exterior but is very caring on the inside.
